net.kuujo.vertigo.rpc

Interface Executor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component<Executor>

    public interface Executor
extends Component<Executor>
    A network executor. Executors may be used to execute portions of networks as remote procedures. Executors work by exploiting circular connections between components. Thus, when using an executor the network must be setup in a specific manner.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      • setAutoRetry

        Executor setAutoRetry(boolean retry)
        Sets the executor auto-retry option. If this option is enabled, the executor will automatically retry sending timed out messages.
        Parameters:
        retry - Indicates whether to automatically executor emitting timed out data.
        Returns:
        The called executor instance.

Executor setRetryAttempts(int attempts)
        Deprecated.

        Returns:
        The called executor instance.

      • setExecuteInterval

        Executor setExecuteInterval(long interval)
        Sets the execute delay. The execute interval indicates the interval at which the executor will attempt to poll the execute handler for new data.
        Parameters:
        interval - The empty execute interval.
        Returns:
        The called executor instance.

      • getExecuteInterval

        long getExecuteInterval()
        Gets the execute interval. The execute delay indicates the interval at which the executor will attempt to poll the execute handler for new data.
        Returns:
        The empty execute interval.

      • executeHandler

        Executor executeHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Executor> handler)
        Sets an execute handler. The execute handler will be periodically polled for new data. Each time the execute handler is polled only a single message should be emitted. This allows the executor to maintain control over the flow of data. If the execute handler is called but fails to emit any new messages to the network, the executor will reschedule the next call to the handler for a period in the near future.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be invoked for executing the network.
        Returns:
        The called executor instance.

      • drainHandler

        Executor drainHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Void> handler)
        Sets a drain handler on the executor. The drain handler will be called when the execute queue is available to receive new messages.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be invoked when a full execute queue is emptied.
        Returns:
        The called executor instance.

      • execute

        MessageId execute(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body,
                org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<JsonMessage>> resultHandler)
        Executes the network via the default stream.
        Parameters:
        body - The message body.
        resultHandler - An asynchronous result handler to be called with the execution result. The result handler will be called only once the source message has been fully processed. If multiple results are received for the same execution, the result handler will be called once for each result. If the execution times out, a TimeoutException will be the cause of the failure. If the emitted message is explicitly failed, a FailureException will be the cause of the failure.
        Returns:
        The emitted message correlation identifier.

      • execute

        MessageId execute(String stream,
                org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body,
                org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<JsonMessage>> resultHandler)
        Executes the network via a non-default stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream to which to emit the message.
        body - The message body.
        resultHandler - An asynchronous result handler to be called with the execution result. The result handler will be called only once the source message has been fully processed. If multiple results are received for the same execution, the result handler will be called once for each result. If the execution times out, a TimeoutException will be the cause of the failure. If the emitted message is explicitly failed, a FailureException will be the cause of the failure.
        Returns:
        The emitted message correlation identifier.
